reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a bargain place to stay, Eric and Betty couldn't possibly be any more friendly! and its run very well.
reviews.title: good value for money and great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were really spacious, the clothes washing facilites are very good and great value ($3) it has a pool and kitchen if required.
reviews.title: excellent location, affordable accommodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only thing i can put down is the floor of our room was pretty filthy, we ended up cleaning it our selves with one of the towels, which came up black. On passing one of the cleaners they don't seem to change the mop water from room to room which would explain it!
reviews.title: only suitable for travellers used to crummy hostel accomodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rest of the room was clean though, especially the white sheets, (the top cover could have done with a wash but we didnt use it anyway.)
reviews.title: Decent for a hostel. Be careful if you book tours through them.

reviews.text: But for $36 a night i'm not complaining, it WAS great value and the location could not have been better and when it comes to booking tours and suchlike they get great discounts!
reviews.title: Excellent value for $!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wow! What can I say...it's a small hostel/hotel property in the PERFECT location! The rooms are simple, but comfortable. They include a private bathroom, a queen & twin bed (great for spreading your luggage!), a little closet, fridge, A/C, ceiling fans and cable tv. We only paid around $45 US per night, so we didn't expect much, but they over exceeded our expectations! The staff was wonderful...all of them! They helped us book discount trips and recommended places to eat and go. There is a small kitchen that you can use too; we ended our 3 wk tour of Aussie there, so it was great to finally cook for ourselves! The hotel itself is literally across the street from the Esplanade, right next door to the night markets and a 2 minute walk to "town". You are in the middle of EVERYTHING! I think it's probably the best location in Cairns. We did a couple of tours on the water and we were able to walk to the boat in less than 5 minutes. The Esplanade pool is beautiful and very well kept and there are tons of little gas stove/grills at the park for anyone to enjoy! There was always some kind of free entertainment going on there, which was really fun! There are plenty of places to go out at night too...just depends on your style. If you're a beer drinker, try the Carlton Mid, it's great! Another tip, if you want to try Kangaroo meat (like us) don't bother spending $30 for a meal at one of the local restaurants, buy some at the grocer and cook it yourself at the park. We spent $4 US and got 3 steaks! Oh, you have to go to the night markets and try one of the Chinese full body massages! They end up being like $12 US and are TOTALLY worth every penny! We went twice and wish we could have gone more! Bottom line, if you're looking for luxury, go elsewhere. If you want a great hotel/hostel in a fantastic location for an awesome value, this is your place! Well I hope this helps!
reviews.title: What a great little place!!!

likes.liked: — The location, the staff, the price....
likes.disliked: — The only thing we didn't like was leaving!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 6 nights whilst in Cairns. The rooms are clean, if very basic, but in the motel room you get a ceiling fan and aircon, plus tea coffee, sugar and milk replenished every day and a kettle and cups. There is also a fridge for you to keep anything cool in, and we had a double and a single bed. If you book a trip via the hotel then they will let you leave your bags there for free if you want to shoot off somewhere for a few days and not lug everything with you, otherwise it only costs a few AUS per day. The place is right on the Esplanade almost opposite the lagon swimming pool (open and free to everyone), just minutes walk from shops, internet cafes, food places and the train station. The hotel itself has a small pool out the back and a video room as well as cooking and laundry facilities and a general get together area. It is quiet at night so you can get a good sleep if you want, but not too far from "where its all at" if you want to go out and party. The staff are very friendly and couldnt do enough to help us out. Rodney is a Gem and We'd like to thank him again for all his help and advise, especially the great deal with the hire car.
reviews.title: Rodney is great

reviews.text: All in all it is great value for money with a friendly personal style.
reviews.title: Best hostel ever...fact!!!

likes.liked: — The staff, site, price...I could go on and on

reviews.title: Charming
reviews.text: This has to be the best hostel ever...as the title suggests. I stayed at the Bellview in Cairns for the whole of August this year and it was the best experience of my life. The staff on the front desk are soooooo helpful, and really friendly! They made my trip! I was travelling on my own and was a little nervous about it, but they made sure I was ok - they suggested great places to eat out, visit, and most importantly....shop :o) I can't speak for the dorms, but the room I stayed in was just right for me, and even though it is on the esplanade - the busiest part of Cairns, it was so quiet at night - lovely. It is also on the same strip as the night markets, which, if you stay in Cairns at some point...you have got to visit - they're awesome. Also, on the next street up are internet cafes and every saturday there is a little market on the lagoon area, right outside the hostel. I would also recommend The Bellview if you are looking to do a lot of ocean-going (its across from the harbour)....however, I would just generally recommend the bellview! It really was that good!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: p.s. there is also the best gelatto (ice cream) place down the road - ask at reception!!! Happy travelling...
reviews.title: 'Bates Motel' Experience

likes.disliked: — Old and dinghy room and bathroom

reviews.text: having stayed two nights in Shan-gri-la hotel we found the Bellview to be half the cost but not half the value. Not quite as luxurious but what the heck, we only slept there. Very helpful and friendly staff who went out of their way to facilitate.Would recommend to any budget travellers!
reviews.title: Good luck from Ireland !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Bellview for 5 nights in late March/early April, and would definitely recommend it to budget travellers! The front desk staff were helpful and friendly, and overall the rooms were basic but nice.
reviews.title: Great for Budget Travellers

likes.liked: — Proximity to nearby attractions, very friendly staff, large reasonably priced rooms
likes.disliked: — regular motel room was dirty, with cockroaches, ant infestation, loud neighbors

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only problem we had was when we booked a regular motel room instead of a deluxe and ended up in a room with cockroaches, an ant infestation, and noisy neighbors who smoked right outside our window in the middle of the night. We asked the front desk to change our room, and we were able to move right away. If you can afford it, the "deluxe" motel room is worth the extra $10 a night!
reviews.title: Service above and beyond the call of duty

likes.liked: — Location, price and the great staff

reviews.title: Fantastic! beats a hostel anyday!!
reviews.text: The deluxe was very large, with a double bed and a twin bed, a tv, aircon, refrigerator and private ensuite. They also provided complimentary tea with milk and sugar, which was a nice touch.

We booked tour packages through the front desk and received slight discounts (around $5), and were happy with all the tours we took. Word to the wise: stock up on anti-sea-sickness medication if they tell you it's going to be windy on the day of your trip to the Great Barrier Reef!
reviews.title: Great location, I would stay here again

reviews.text: I stayed at this hostel for 10 weeks. It is simple but it´s well placed in Cairns near everything. I stayed in the sharing room with other 03 guys. The time I stayed there they offered free dinner at a pub called Samuel´s, it was great ! They have a good pool to cool off.
reviews.title: A really great place in Cairns !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are not looking for an up market hotel the Bellview is really conveniente place to stay in Cairns.
reviews.title: Very good situation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Bellview has a very good situation right in the centre of Cairns, with basics but clean rooms. Staff is very useful and the booking centre is one of the best in Cairns. They had the best prices in nearly everything we booked through them, from trips around to diving courses.
reviews.title: Fantastic place!

reviews.text: My fiance and I (26,22) stayed at the Bellview for 6 nights in October. We booked in after reading reviews on this site and weren't disappointed - it is great for the price and the main bonus is the people are so friendly and helpful. We booked white water rafting and a liveaboard scuba diving trip with them and they recommended great tour operators. We had a motel style room for $65 per night, which had a double bed and a single and was really big, clean and comfortable. The en-suite was also clean and fully functional, if a little dated. The shower was really powerful and the air con worked fine.
reviews.title: Wonderful!

reviews.text: It's just across from the lagoon on the sea front where you can use the amazing public pool (the one in the Bellview is fine for a quick cool down but not particularly big). We would definitely recommend the bellview to anyone who wants to experience Cairns on a bit of a budget but wants somehwere clean, friendly, safe and central!
reviews.title: Great location, great amenities, clean suites but bad acoustics
